page.title: 16Farmers Interview continued.
page.content: only calling the vet when he is in serious difficulty.The current fashion is for leaner beef and while the Hereford/Friesian cross is still popular there is pressure to sell the cattle lighter,which means less profit as they sell by weight.There are 90 acres of permanent grass on the farm, and the rest is rotated on a 5 years grass 4 years grain schedule. Mr Padfield does not think the EEC has any obvious effect on his farming, but he is not optimistic about the future of farming generally,because of its economic structure,with the banks owning about a third of the land,and profits declining to the point where the banks might not wish to continue in land.
